Posts.Content: jabnee wrote: About a month ago I accidentally found a lump on my left breast very close to my armpit.  It's very easy to feel, I only brushed over my skin and noticed it.  It's pretty hard and more long than round.  I went to my PCP who immediately scheduled me for a mammogram and ultrasound.  I had about a 2 week wait for the tests and during this time there was no change in the lump.   I went in today for the mammogram and ultrasound.  After the mammogram, the radiologist said he saw nothing.  I went down the hall for the ultrasound.  Again the radiologist came in and said he only saw normal tissue.  He asked me where the lump was.  When I pointed it out to him, he could easily feel it.  He turned the machine back on and still couldn't see anything.  His reccomendation is to just "watch it".   I am waiting to hear back from my PCP, which probably won't be until Monday.  When I saw her she told me that she wasn't going to mess around with it.  If they couldn't give her a definite answer with the mammo and u/s, she would send me to a breast surgeon.   My question is, if she doesn't want to send me to a surgeon should I demand it?  I'm 38 and have a pretty low risk, but I want to know without a doubt what it is.  I have 3 young boys who need their mother.  So, if she agrees with the radiologist do I trust them or do I fight until I get a definite answer?  Thanks! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Lump felt , but not visible on mammogram or ultrasound jabnee Maddog23

Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2013 04:40AM jabnee wrote: Thanks for sharing your story Rosevalley.  Sometimes I start to feel like I'm being a hypochondriac or something since the doctors are telling me not to worry and just watch it.  Even my husband thinks that what we've found out so far is good news, and points to the fact that it's probably nothing.  I just feel like I'm right back where I started.  I still have a lump and I still don't know what it is.  I was expecting a call from my doctor yesterday, but didn't get it.  I know they aren't that busy.  It's a doctor's office in a very small town. I see the nurse practioner there and I really like her.  When I first went in she seemed very concerned and said that if the mammo and u/s didn't give her DEFINITE answers, she would send me on to a breast surgeon because she didn't want to play around with it.  I got no definite answers and now she's changing her tune.  I am wondering if she feels like because the radiologist says it's ok (even though he said he could feel the lump, but not see it on anything) that she should go along with him?  I don't know.  I don't understand why she won't call me back.  I don't understand why, if I'm still concerned, she won't just refer me to  a breast surgeon.  If I can't ever get back in touch with her, or if when I do she doesn't want to refer me on to someone else, what can I do?  Can I request a copy of my report and try to find a doctor myself?  My insurance doesn't require a referral for a specialist, but would a breast surgeon want one before they would see me?  I'm sorry I'm rambling!  I am just so frustrated!  I thought this would all be quick and easy, and that one way or another I would know what I was dealing with.  I never expected to have to fight just to get someone to tell me what this lump is! Brandie-McAdams:  Good luck on your biopsy! Alicia-Rae:  I'm so sorry you're being ignored too!  Keep fighting and don't give up until you get some answers.  I figure if we just worry them to death, they will give us what we want to shut us up!  LOL
Posts.Title: Lump felt , but not visible on mammogram or ultrasound jabnee Maddog23

Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2013 12:00PM jabnee wrote: Well, I am not a patient person!  My doctor has never called me back despite me leaving 3 messages.  I called the breast care clinic at the cancer center a few miles away.  I explained my situation to them and they made me an appointment for the 24th of this month!  I had no idea I could have gone there from the start, but I could have.  I will basically be starting over because she said they don't do second opinions on other people's films, but they will be getting copies of my mammogram and ultrasound to compare to the new ones.  I feel so much better knowing that this is going to be in the hands of a doctor who specializes in breast issues!  Now if I can just keep my mind off it until the 24th!
Posts.Title: Lump felt , but not visible on mammogram or ultrasound jabnee Maddog23

Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2013 02:23PM jabnee wrote: My doctor's office called today.  It was just one of the girls who works at the desk.  She said that my report said that I had "clusters of dense glandular tissue thoughout the breasts".  So she says, that means he just saw normal tissue and everything's fine.  I told her that to me it says that because I have such dense breasts, he can't see the lump that everyone, including him, could feel.  I told her that wasn't good enough for me because I still didn't know what it was.  She said she would pass along to my doctor that I am still concerned and have her call me back. You ladies know a lot more about this than me.  Doesn't that wording sound like I have very dense breasts which would just help to hide any abnormalities that might be there?  I am so tired of having to fight with doctors.  I went through some major fertility and pregnancy issues over the last two years, and I had done my research.  There were times I knew what my doctor was telling me was completely wrong.  It was so frustrating and I really don't want to have to go down that road again.  I just want someone to tell with 100% certainty whether or not this lump is anything to worry about.  Is that too much to ask?
Posts.Title: Lump felt , but not visible on mammogram or ultrasound jabnee Maddog23

Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2013 02:32PM jabnee wrote: Thanks lizzib4u!  I am so grateful to everyone here for making not feel like a crazy person!  It's constantly in the back of my mind, but I'm not freaking out nor have I convinced myself I have cancer.  I know that the odds are in my favor, but I also know there is a chance.  There are always those few who were very low risk, and end up with cancer anyway.  I'm sure none of them thought they would be in that small percentage.  Who does?  I just think it is irresponsible of me not to get a definite answer.  I have 3 kids a husband who wouldn't know how to function without me!  LOL
Posts.Title: Lump felt , but not visible on mammogram or ultrasound jabnee Maddog23

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2013 09:21PM jabnee wrote: Thanks for the input ladies.  I am definitely going to insist on more testing.  I really feel like my PCP will send me on to a surgeon anyway.  As much as I don't want to be poked and prodded, this is way to important to ignore!
Posts.Title: Lump felt , but not visible on mammogram or ultrasound jabnee Maddog23
